description.narrative: The Fundacion Imaymana (Imaymana Foundation) strives to restore the environment of the Parish of Nanegalito. This is a biologically diverse area with a high level of endemism and a 60% rate of forest cover. Though tourism, milk production, and agricultural activities are going well, extensive and little planned out livestock herding has led to the degradation of soils, fragmentation of forests, and a diminished quality and quantity of drinking water. Especially problematic is the availability of water for human consumption during the five dry months from July to December, leading to health problems among the entire population in the area. The organization aims to conduct ecological restoration program in a water catchment area that provides communities within the Parish of Nanegalito with water. The group will monitor the development of the area for the first 4 months after the start of the project and report to all affected communities about the project's lessons learned. 1,471 women and 1,555 men will be involved in the activities.
